intro: Amphidoxa demidium, commonly known as the dwarf lily of the Nile, is a perennial herbaceous plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Amaryllidaceae family and is characterized by its strap-like, grassy leaves and clusters of white or pale pink flowers. The plant produces small, oval-shaped berries that mature to a dark purple color. It thrives in well-drained soils and prefers full sun to partial shade, making it a popular choice for rock gardens and containers. Due to its ornamental value and drought tolerance, it is widely cultivated in gardens across the world.
